topic.title: Change Compute Host Pattern Filter in Monasca Transform

section.p: Monasca Transform identifies compute host metrics by pattern matching on hostname dimension in the incoming monasca metrics. Default pattern is of the form compNNN.. e.g. comp001, comp002 etc and is denoted by filter by expression "-comp[0-9]+-" in the transformation specs. In case the compute host names follow a different pattern other than the standard pattern above, the filter by expression when aggregating metrics will have to be changed.

ol.li: Back up existing transform_specs sudo cp /opt/stack/venv/monasca_transform-20161213T224923Z/lib/python2.7/site-packages/monasca_transform/data_driven_specs/transform_specs/transform_specs.json /opt/stack/venv/monasca_transform-20161213T224923Z/lib/python2.7/site-packages/monasca_transform/data_driven_specs/transform_specs/transform_specs.json.backup

Edit transform_specs.json on all the three controller nodes.
transform_specs.json is located at sudo vi /opt/stack/venv/monasca_transform-XXXXXX/lib/python2.7/site-packages/monasca_transform/data_driven_specs/transform_specs/transform_specs.json sudo vi /opt/stack/venv/monasca_transform-20161213T224923Z/lib/python2.7/site-packages/monasca_transform/data_driven_specs/transform_specs/transform_specs.json

Repeat step 3 to change all host metric transformation specs in the same json file.
Transformation specs will have to be changed for following metric_ids namely "mem_total_all", "mem_usable_all", "disk_total_all", "disk_usable_all", "cpu_total_all", "cpu_total_host", "cpu_util_all", "cpu_util_host"
Repeat steps 1 to 4 on three controller nodes
Run Monasca Transform Reconfigure cd ~/scratch/ansible/next/hos/ansible ansible-playbook -i hosts/verb_hosts monasca-transform-reconfigure.yml

section.note: Please note that in transform_specs.json is not managed by the lifecycle manager and is part of the monasca-transform code base, so if an upgrade is done these changes will be wiped out and will have to be re-instated by following the steps above.
